stocks.impact_theory: NVIDIA reported record Q4 FY2026 revenue of $68.1B (beat est $66.2B), EPS $1.62 (beat $1.54), data center $62.3B up 75% YoY, Q1 guide $78B (beat $72B). Despite beats, stock fell 5% on profit-taking, concerns over AI hyperscaler capex sustainability (62% growth 2026 vs 73% 2025), first RPO QoQ decline in 3 years misinterpreted as bookings slowdown. Economic implications: AI demand robust but potential supply glut or capex peak in 2027. Market psychology: 'Sell the news' after massive runup, high expectations unmet even on beats. Historical parallels: Post-2023 earnings after AI hype peaks. Analogies: 1) Climber reaching summit too fast, pausing for breath; 2) Party where host serves feast but guests worry hangover.

news_impact_analysis.reasoning: X sentiment mixed (dip buyers vs capex doubts), web news highlights underwhelming reaction despite beats, dragging semis and Nasdaq; Goldman notes 'very good not good enough'.

potential_profit_risks.long_position: Buy dip for rebound to $195 (+5%), AI story intact
potential_profit_risks.short_position: Short to $175 (-6%), if capex fears grow
potential_profit_risks.key_risks: Unexpected AI demand surge; broader market rally; options expiration volatility.

stocks.justification: Major event with clear data from earnings, X/news consensus on reaction drivers.

stocks.impact_theory: FSLR Q4 earnings with weak 2026 sales guidance ~$1B below consensus, stock plunged 13.6%. Event: Guidance reflects softer demand or pricing pressures in solar amid policy uncertainty. Economic: Renewables slowdown vs EV boom; implications for clean energy transition costs. Psychology: Fear of margin compression, analyst downgrades (Baird Neutral $205, Wells $255). Parallels: 2020 solar glut selloff. Analogies: 1) Ship captain lowering sails before storm; 2) Runner slowing pace after strong start.

news_impact_analysis.reasoning: News uniform on guidance miss, multiple PT cuts; X limited but aligns with sector weakness.

potential_profit_risks.long_position: Wait for stabilization, +10% to $200 on policy tailwinds
potential_profit_risks.key_risks: IRA policy boosts; China competition eases; Q1 surprise.

stocks.justification: Clear guidance trigger, but renewables volatile with policy.

stocks.impact_theory: JAZZ Q4 2025 EPS $6.64 beat, FY rev in-line, oxybate franchise outlook positive; stock +13%. Event: Earnings beat resets expectations. Economic: Pharma growth amid patent cliffs. Psychology: Relief rally on stable guidance. Parallels: Post-2022 earnings surges. Analogies: 1) Patient recovering faster than expected; 2) Engine revving after tune-up.

news_impact_analysis.reasoning: News positive on beat and outlook; X engagement high on gains.

stocks.justification: Strong earnings reaction, but biotech volatile.

stocks.impact_theory: CRM Q4 rev $11.2B beat, EPS beat 25%, but FY26 rev guide below est at $46B; $50B buyback announced. Mixed: Agentforce AI growth vs growth slowdown fears. Economic: Enterprise software shift to AI agents. Psychology: Buyback supportive but guide disappoints. Parallels: 2022 growth scare. Analogies: 1) Buffet buying back but slowing sales; 2) Athlete strong sprint but marathon pace down.

news_impact_analysis.reasoning: Beat but guide miss, controversial buyback; stock mixed but slid.

potential_profit_risks.key_risks: AI adoption accelerates; macro IT spend up.

stocks.impact_theory: MELI Q4 beat rev but profit miss, margins pressured; stock -8%. Event: Execution strong but profitability concerns in LatAm e-comm/fintech. Economic: EM growth but FX/inflation headwinds. Psychology: Bulls see buy, bears margin fears. Parallels: 2022 Argentina crisis dips. Analogies: 1) Rocket with strong thrust but heavy fuel; 2) Growing tree in rocky soil.

news_impact_analysis.reasoning: Profit miss dominates headlines despite rev beat; Wedbush upgrade but slide.

stocks.justification: EM exposure adds volatility; less X buzz.
